title: Head of Financial Systems
content:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is recruiting for a Head of Financial Systems in Plantation, FL. You will operate as the Business Lead within the Accounting and Finance organization responsible for the implementation, and integration of our financial reporting systems in Oracle Cloud as we continue to grow.
A strong understanding of the Accounting business function is a must have as the individual will play a key role in projects, representing the accounting organization from a technical lens, developing and executing fit for purpose solutions.
The individual must demonstrate strong problem solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication skills. Be the change agent and manage stakeholders. Collaborate across programs and technical teams to remain integrated with strategic initiatives.
In addition, the role would also work very closely with the Finance Transformation team, strategizing on roadmap, implementing new technology as applicable. The role will also own post production support, monitor and run regular maintenance (quarterly releases, regression testing) of systems owned by Accounting, such as Blackline, Coupa, Analytics and Automation tools, etc.
What You'll Do:

Manage implementations and integrations of Oracle ERP financial systems for accounting and finance departments, primarily with new geographies, verticals, etc.
Manage business requirements, documenting data and operational workflows, developing and executing the roll-out, managing user acceptance testing, providing end-user training and manage go-live execution.
Work closely with decision makers across departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement and support technology solutions that impact the accounting/finance department.
Collaborate with all levels of the Accounting teams, Finance Transformation, IT, and other business stakeholders during projects, technology enhancements, etc. to propose solutions that anticipate future needs, leverage knowledge of industry trends.
Create and deliver documentation for each phase of SDLC including but not limited to creating user requirements documentation, system impact assessment, test plan, test scripts, traceability matrix, training plan, communications plan, end user guides, RAID logs, status reports, data migration plan, etc.
Support Accounting team through period close (month end, quarter end, year-end)
Conduct gap analysis between delivered functionality and finance requirements and recommend solutions
Maintain a thorough understanding of the accounting system design, particularly as it relates to data flow
Foster and grow a high performing team. Lead a team of experts, and coach them on best in class practices, when understanding problem statements, evaluating solutions and executing on time.
Lead, drive and refine systems where needed to support existing and new reporting requirements while maintaining reporting continuity with minimal disruptions.
Undertake and manage special projects and other reporting needs as required (i.e. SOD remediation, re-implementations, acquisition integrations, etc.)

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Finance, MIS required, MBA and or CPA preferred.
15+ years of experience working in senior level Finance and/or technology roles
5+ years of experience specializing in Oracle ERP Cloud based applications, primarily around enhancements, monitoring, maintenance and testing.
5+ years financial systems administration experience (supporting analytical database applications, web-based reporting applications, general ledger systems and automated processes)
Demonstrated experience in implementing and enhancing financial systems to be able to succeed in a global, complex, and innovative environment.
Leadership skills to effectively direct and drive their diverse team (ranging in size and location) to achieve results in a global, fast paced organization.
Demonstrated ability to deliver measurable and value-added results, with a customer first mindset, ensuring service levels are above expectation.
Demonstrating delivery to a target audience of C-Suite, VP/Sr. Dir / Dir level stakeholders to reinforce stakeholder buy-in.
Strategic thinker with the ability to make connections across workstreams and matrixed organizations
Excellent verbal and written communication, listening, and interpersonal skills
Organized and detail-oriented
Comfort with ambiguity and the ability to logically identify issues and determine recommended resolutions

 Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
